name: Syphilinum
Relationship: Compare: MERC.; KAL. HYD.; NIT-AC.; AUR.; ALUM

Eyes: Feeling of cold air blowing on eye
Diplopia; one image seen below the other
Lids swollen; pain intense at night; ptosis
Chronic, recurrent, phlyctenular inflammation of cornea; successive crops of phlyctenules and abrasions of epithelial layer of cornea; photophobia intense, lachrymation, profuse
Respiratory: Cough dry, hard; worse at night; windpipe sensitive to touch
Lancinating pains from base of heart to apex at night
Aphonia; chronic asthma in summer, wheezing and rattling
Mind: Loss of memory; remembers everything previous to his illness
Fears the night, and the suffering from exhaustion on awakening
Apathetic; feels as if going insane or being paralyzed
Head: Top of head feels as if coming off
Stupefying cephalgia
Pain in bones of head
Falling of the hair
Linear pains from temples across, or from eyes backward; cause sleeplessness and delirium at night
Nose: Caries of nasal bones, hard palate and septum, with perforation; ozaena
Female: Leucorrhoea profuse, thin, watery, acrid, with sharp, knife-like pain in ovaries
Skin: Reddish-brown eruption, with a disagreeable odor
Mouth: Teeth decay at gum; edges serrated, dwarfed
Tongue coated, teeth-indented; deep longitudinal cracks
Excessive flow of saliva; it runs out of mouth when sleeping
Extremities: Redness and rawness between toes  rheumatism, muscles are caked in hard knot or lumps
Sciatica; worse at night; better about daybreak
Rheumatism of shoulder-joint, at insertion of deltoid
Ears: Caries of ossicles in ear of syphilitic origin

details: Utter prostration and debility in the morning. Shifting rheumatic pains. Chronic eruptions and rheumatism. Ichthyosis. Syphilitic affections. Pains from darkness to daylight; decrease and increase gradually. Hereditary tendency to alcoholism. ULCERATION OF mouth, nose, genitals, skin. SUCCESSION OF ABSCESSES.
dosage: The highest potencies only, and in
